speculation_rules.label: Speculation Rules API
speculation_rules.comment:
What are Speculation Rules?
The Speculation Rules API allows browsers to prefetch or prerender pages before users click on them, significantly improving navigation speed.

How it works:
• Prefetch: Downloads page resources in advance (lower resource usage)
• Prerender: Fully renders the page in background (faster but uses more resources)

Eagerness levels control when speculation triggers:
• Eager: Immediately when the page loads
• Moderate: After 200ms hover over the link
• Conservative: On mouse/touch down (just before click)

enabled.label: Enable Speculation Rules
enabled.comment: Enable the Speculation Rules API to improve page load performance. Only works in supported browsers (Chrome 109+, Edge 109+).

eager_mode.label: Eager Mode - Action Type
eager_mode.comment:
Choose what happens for links matching Eager selectors:
• Prefetch: Downloads resources only (recommended for most cases)
• Prerender: Fully renders the page (use sparingly, high resource usage)

eager_selectors.label: Eager Mode - CSS Selectors
eager_selectors.comment:
Links matching these selectors will be speculated immediately when the page loads.
Enter one CSS selector per line.

Examples:
• .product-link - All product links
• a[href*="/catalog/"] - Links containing /catalog/
• #main-menu a - All links in main menu

⚠️ Use sparingly: Too many eager rules can slow down the current page.

moderate_mode.label: Moderate Mode - Action Type
moderate_mode.comment:
Choose what happens for links matching Moderate selectors:
• Prefetch: Downloads resources only (recommended)
• Prerender: Fully renders the page (higher resource usage)

moderate_selectors.label: Moderate Mode - CSS Selectors
moderate_selectors.comment:
Links matching these selectors will be speculated after hovering for 200ms.
Enter one CSS selector per line.

Good for:
• Navigation menus
• Category links
• "View More" buttons

Examples:
• .nav-menu a
• .category-products .product-name a
• .toolbar a

conservative_mode.label: Conservative Mode - Action Type
conservative_mode.comment:
Choose what happens for links matching Conservative selectors:
• Prefetch: Downloads resources only
• Prerender: Fully renders the page

Conservative mode has minimal performance impact as it only triggers just before click.

conservative_selectors.label: Conservative Mode - CSS Selectors
conservative_selectors.comment:
Links matching these selectors will be speculated on mouse/touch down (just before click).
Enter one CSS selector per line.

Safest option for:
• All site links
• Dynamic content
• User-specific pages

Examples:
• a[href^="/"] - All internal links
• .product-item a
• a:not([href^="http"]) - All relative links
